TopicTitle: no debris for switch vessel option

Articles.Content:
Hey, just though right now (while watching Dortmunder on the ksp-tv)

It could be nice to have the switch vessel (default [ ] ) not switching to debris as an option.

may be [] switch to next non debris vessel

and shift + [] switch to next vessel.

Shouldn't be too hard to implement, and could help getting to the correct vessel after a crash.
...that's a really good idea. I like it.

I'm itsme86 and I support this message.

Or even reverse the hotkeys so [] still behaves the way it always has, but SHIFT + [] allows for the new behavior.
This is a great idea, I'm constantly plagued by this issue.
Totally agree with this, for such a little tweak it sure would save a lot of headaches.

What really makes this issue a pain is the "cannot switch vessels while moving over terrain" check. You hit "[", end up on a bit of moving debris, and then cannot get off the debris - stuck on it forever until you force kill the program.
As someone who's about to lose 2 hours of gameplay because the game decided I wanted to focus on a piece of debris instead of the ship I just undocked, yes please.

I really agree, I ABSOLUTELY HATE IT when I'm switching to another vessel, then it gives the launch clamps and then I can't get off the launch clamps !!

this would be sooo nice

Um, Shift is one of the worst keys to use for this. Throttle up your ship and then jump to a nearby piece of debris? No thank you.

How about alt+[] to switch to debris?
Love it! really would love to see this introduced.
